column1: hihiyas 160841087317 "2017-05-19 15:43:15 GMT" https://hihiyas.tumblr.com/post/160841087317/makibakla-mulasawala-these-are-the "makibakla: mulasawala:  These are the organizations in the Philippines that defend the rights of people like Lola Eudocia Tomas Pulido.  1. http://www.anakbayan.org/donate 2. http://www.anakpawis.net 3. http://kadamay-natl.blogspot.com/ 4. http://kilusangmagbubukidngpilipinas.com 5. http://www.gabrielaph.com/ 6. https://migranteinternational.org/  There are also US chapters of these organizations!! Find a local chapter near you to get involved! www.anakbayanusa.org www.gabrielausa.org https://migrantepartylist-usa.org/ STATEMENT FROM GABRIELA USA‚ÄôS NATIONAL CHAIRPERSON
column2: ¬†Irma Shauf-Bajar FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE May 18
column3: 2017 Filipino Women Against Modern Day Slavery The article written by Alex Tizon regarding the story of Eudocia Pulido and her forced migration and exploitation as a modern day slave in the United States highlights the current conditions of Filipino women. Eudocia Pulido story cannot be understood outside of the context of the Philippine society and history rooted in U.S. imperialism and neoliberal economic policies that have caused the systemic suffering of many underpaid domestic helpers like Lola.  The Philippines is one of the largest labor exporters in the world with 6
column4: 000 Filipinos‚Äî60% women‚Äîleaving the country every single day to work
column7: and landlessness. Lured to apply for positions that do not exist
column11: and isolated in a foreign country ‚Äì thousands of OFWs end up working in virtual slavery. Recruiters and employment agencies take advantage of their workers
column12: by charging exorbitant fees and loans and threatening their workers with deportation or physical violence to the workers and their families. Living in fear and with no place to go
column15: and exploitation in order to survive.  It is important that we do not whitewash the writer‚Äôs parents‚Äô and family‚Äôs crimes of slavery
column17: and trafficking. Alex Tizon‚Äôs account of Eudocia Pulido‚Äôs story does not exonerate him from his family‚Äôs complicity in the abuse and exploitation of another human being. And we also must recognize this particular experience is not an isolated one
column18: and stems from the Philippines‚Äô feudal patriarchal and imperialist structure. The commodification and exploitation of generations of Filipina women continues to be an inherent effect of the ever worsening conditions‚Äìconditions which will persist and generate many more Eudocia‚Äôs until comprehensive and fundamental socio-economic and political changes are made to address the root causes of the country‚Äôs poverty.  Members of GABRIELA USA continue to take action and call for an end to the exploitative system in the Philippines and denounce the Philippine government for its neglect of its own people within the country and lack of protection of OFWs abroad. In addition
column19: we uplift the voices of Filipino migrant women to tell their own stories. GABRIELA USA seeks to empower migrant women to know and understand their rights
column20: to fight back against oppression and exploitation
column21: and to participate in the movement for national democracy in the Philippines. If you are moved by Lola‚Äôs story we encourage you to join a chapter of GABRIELA USA and join the fight against feudal-patriarchy and the systems of power that allow women like Lola to be forced into exploitation.  ### " False text

column1: hihiyas 156443870362 "2017-01-27 14:30:20 GMT" https://hihiyas.tumblr.com/post/156443870362/rogue-one-subverts-asian-male-stereotypes-and "desiree-rodriguez:   Let‚Äôs start with Chirrut
column2: played by Donnie Yen. When Chirrut first showed up in the movie
column3: I had a sense of dread: ‚Äúah
column4: here we go with the magical Asian stereotype.‚Äù After all
column8: mysterious platitudes about the kyber crystal necklace Jyn was wearing. He knew martial arts
column9: and it looked like that was going to be his defining characteristic. But the more interactions we saw between Chirrut and the other characters
column10: the more revolutionary he seemed as a character ‚Äî while the TV Tropes page may technically list Chirrut as a ‚ÄúMagical Asian‚Äù (your mileage may vary
column13: he turned the stereotype on its head. After all
column14: here was an Asian male character who was also Force-sensitive
column19: but he was also impish and wry.     In a lesser movie
column20: he‚Äôd have been the Mr. Miyagi or Pai-Mei of Rogue One
column21: whose sole purpose was to offer bland mystic platitudes while teaching the white protagonist. But Chirrut didn‚Äôt just speak in platitudes or proverbs

column1: hihiyas 156160578186 "2017-01-21 08:30:16 GMT" https://hihiyas.tumblr.com/post/156160578186/the-science-world-is-freaking-out-over-this "esaa-tas:  verdanthandshake:  corntortillaprince:  mindblowingscience:   A 25-year-old student has just come up with a way to fight drug-resistant superbugs without antibiotics. The new approach has so far only been tested in the lab and on mice
column2: but it could offer a potential solution to antibiotic resistance
column3: which is now getting so bad that the United Nations recently declared it a ‚Äúfundamental threat‚Äù to global health. Antibiotic-resistant bacteria already kill around 700
column5: but a recent study suggests that number could rise to around 10 million by 2050. In addition to common hospital superbug
column7: scientists are now also concerned that gonorrhoea is about tobecome resistant to all remaining drugs. But Shu Lam
column8: a 25-year-old PhD student at the University of Melbourne in Australia
column9: has developed a star-shaped polymer that can kill six different superbug strains without antibiotics
column10: simply by ripping apart their cell walls. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve discovered that [the polymers] actually target the bacteria and kill it in multiple ways
column11: ‚Äù Lam told Nicola Smith from The Telegraph. ‚ÄúOne method is by physically disrupting or breaking apart the cell wall of the bacteria. This creates a lot of stress on the bacteria and causes it to start killing itself.‚Äù The research has been published in Nature Microbiology
column13: it‚Äôs already being hailed by scientists in the field as ‚Äúa breakthrough that could change the face of modern medicine‚Äù. Before we get too carried away
column14: it‚Äôs still very early days. So far
column15: Lam has only tested her star-shaped polymers on six strains of drug-resistant bacteria in the lab
column16: and on one superbug in live mice. But in all experiments
column17: they‚Äôve been able to kill their targeted bacteria - and generation after generation don‚Äôt seem to develop resistance to the polymers.  Continue Reading.  Her name is Shu Lam and her name belongs in the title. Give women of color their proper recognition for their constant world-saving knowledges and actions.  You can read more about her research (which published in November yaaay!) here.  FIVE PARAGRAHS (although short) before her fucking name was mentioned. " False link
